intro: Calonyction speciosum var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy calonyction, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value comes from its compact growth habit and delicate floral display. It is often cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal and drought tolerance.
